_description: Edit this file to match your network setup. Replace the example values below with your actual network names and locations.
_documentation: See CONFIG.md for detailed configuration options and examples.

ssid_location_map._example_comment: Map your Wi-Fi network names (SSIDs) to macOS network locations

_default_wifi_comment: Network location to use for unknown Wi-Fi networks
_ethernet_comment: Network location to use when Ethernet cable is connected
_log_comment: Path where log messages are written. This will be automatically configured by install.sh based on installation mode
_setup_instructions: 1. Replace the example SSID names with your actual Wi-Fi network names
2. Ensure the network location names exist in System Preferences > Network > Location
3. Create missing locations with: networksetup -createlocation 'LocationName' populate
5. Remove all lines starting with '_' (they are just comments/examples)
